description: Behaviors for creating and managing lighting systems, light sources, and illumination effects in the game world

constantlight.name: Constant Light
constantlight.description: A simple lighting behavior that keeps a light source on continuously. Features persistent illumination, no activation requirements, and basic light management. Perfect for creating ambient lighting, permanent light sources, and environmental illumination in games.

steps: Configure light properties in GameGuru MAX
Position the light in your game world
Adjust light intensity and color as needed

flamelight.name: Flame Light
flamelight.description: A realistic flame lighting system that simulates candle or campfire illumination with natural flickering and movement. Features intensity variance control, light movement simulation, glow interval adjustment, and realistic flame behavior. Perfect for creating atmospheric lighting, fire effects, and realistic flame illumination in games.

properties.name: Intensity
properties.description: Intensity variance of the flame light (higher = more dramatic flickering)

properties.name: LightOn
properties.description: Whether the light starts on or off (1 = on, 0 = off)

properties.name: LightMove
properties.description: Whether the light position moves to simulate flame movement (1 = move, 0 = static)

properties.name: MoveAmount
properties.description: Amount of movement for the light position (higher = more movement)

properties.name: GlowInterval
properties.description: Interval between glow updates in milliseconds (lower = faster flickering)

steps: Configure intensity variance for flickering effect
Set up light movement for flame simulation
Adjust move amount for realistic movement
Configure glow interval for flickering speed
Adjust settings for desired flame effect

flickerlight.name: Flicker Light
flickerlight.description: A flickering light system that simulates faulty electrical connections with configurable fault levels. Features electrical fault simulation, random flickering patterns, and realistic electrical lighting behavior. Perfect for creating horror atmospheres, broken electrical systems, and unstable lighting effects in games.

properties.name: Faults
properties.description: Level of electrical faults in the supply (higher = more frequent flickering)

properties.name: LightOn
properties.description: Whether the light starts on or off (1 = on, 0 = off)

steps: Configure fault level for flickering intensity
Adjust fault level for desired effect

rotatelight.name: Rotate Light
rotatelight.description: A rotating light system that spins the light around the Y axis at configurable speeds and directions. Features continuous rotation, clockwise and counterclockwise options, speed control, and automatic angle management. Perfect for creating rotating spotlights, lighthouse effects, searchlights, and dynamic rotating illumination in games.

properties.name: Speed
properties.description: Rotation speed of the light (higher = faster rotation)

properties.name: LightOn
properties.description: Whether the light starts on or off (1 = on, 0 = off)

strobelight.name: Strobe Light
strobelight.description: A strobe light system that creates pulsing illumination by bouncing light range between minimum and maximum values at configurable speeds. Features range oscillation, speed control, and automatic direction reversal. Perfect for creating strobe effects, pulsing lights, emergency lighting, and rhythmic illumination patterns in games.

properties.name: MinRange
properties.description: Minimum light range during strobe cycle (lower = dimmer at minimum)

properties.name: MaxRange
properties.description: Maximum light range during strobe cycle (higher = brighter at maximum)

properties.name: Speed
properties.description: Speed of strobe oscillation (higher = faster pulsing)

properties.name: LightOn
properties.description: Whether the light starts on or off (1 = on, 0 = off)

steps: Configure minimum and maximum light ranges
Set strobe speed for pulsing frequency
Verify range cycling between min and max
Adjust speed for desired strobe effect

togglelight.name: Toggle Light
togglelight.description: A simple light toggle system that switches a light on and off when activated by another object or game element. Features external activation, initial state control, and simple on/off switching. Perfect for creating switchable lights, interactive lighting, and light control systems in games.

properties.name: LightOn
properties.description: Whether the light starts on or off (1 = on, 0 = off)

steps: Connect to activating object or trigger

variable_light.name: Variable Light
variable_light.description: A dynamic light system that adjusts light range based on a global variable value. Features variable switch integration, real-time light range adjustment, and global variable monitoring. Perfect for creating dimmable lights, variable intensity lighting, and light systems that respond to game state changes.

properties.name: VARIABLE_SWITCH_USER_GLOBAL
properties.description: Name of the global variable to monitor for light range changes (e.g., 'Variable_Switch1')

steps: Set up global variable name to monitor
